examples: The old government program has become a sacred cow.
I hold with those who say life is sacred.
In Anuradhapura, however, trees were sacred.
They were sacred.
Unlike the other Celtic tribes, Roman legions have no regard for the druids’ sacred role as peacemakers.
words.defineEn: religious and connected with God or a god
words.defineVi: tôn giáo và kết nối với Thiên Chúa hoặc một vị thần

examples: This seems like sacrilege to a lot of people, but some philosophers argue that it’s more compatible with the God of the Bible.
And I feel it's almost a sacrilege to be writing on this because this complexity that we're seeing here is just mind boggling.
words.defineEn: the act of disrespectfully treating a sacred item or place
words.defineVi: hành động đối xử thiếu tôn trọng với một vật phẩm hoặc địa điểm linh thiêng

words.defineEn: to do or give a thing in return for what a person did or gave to one
words.defineVi: để làm hoặc đưa ra một điều để đáp lại những gì một người đã làm hoặc đưa cho một

words.defineEn: an act of requiting; returning in kind
words.defineVi: một hành động yêu cầu; trả lại bằng hiện vật

examples: Even for an existing pharma company that makes API or makes products of one type, for them to go on and venture into making a different type of product, that requires a bit of a learning curve or that requires them doing R&D, getting the requisite approvals from the FDA, making sure that their facility and their manufacturing processes are CGMP compliant.
words.defineEn: necessary for relief or supply
words.defineVi: cần thiết để cứu trợ hoặc cung cấp

words.defineEn: tending to discourage (especially of prices)
words.defineVi: có xu hướng làm nản lòng (đặc biệt là giá cả)

examples: Then, Prohibition happens.
But Prohibition, in you, Fitzgerald found the perfect metaphor for American hypocrisy and debauchery.
The prohibition of drugs also led to more violence and murders around the world.
Dear Prohibition, You were crazy.
In 1933, the 21st Amendment repealed Prohibition - the 13 year long period in our nation’s history when the production or sale of alcohol was illegal.
words.defineEn: a law forbidding the sale of alcoholic beverages
words.defineVi: luật cấm bán đồ uống có cồn

examples: Love is a complex emotion that can bring immense joy and deep sorrow.
He had spent years working as a farmer, which had built his immense physical strength.
Julia's fiancé left her at the altar, causing her immense heartbreak and embarrassment.
Despite his immense wealth, John felt trapped by the constant demands and expectations of his social circle and business partners, demonstrating how a great fortune is a great slavery.
The viral internet meme that gained immense popularity for a brief period became a ten-day wonder, with people sharing and referencing it widely before it faded from the online spotlight.
words.defineEn: extremely great or large
words.defineVi: cực kỳ lớn hoặc lớn

examples: As a traveler, I enjoy exploring new destinations and immersing myself in different cultures.
The exposure response prevention immerses you into more extreme forms of your fear situation to desensitize you from the things that you actually fear.
We like to immerse our bodies in the salty sea.
She grew up in the wilderness of the temperate forests of Montana and immersed herself in the world of animals.
What story would you tell if you could immerse someone in your world?
words.defineEn: thrust or throw into
words.defineVi: đẩy hoặc ném vào

examples: And to some, equality and an expansion of rights felt imminent.
Its sound means imminent danger and often, impending death.
The fear of imminent death is different from other types of fear.
So Twitter and Facebook both have the standard of imminent harm.
They didn't mention any imminent threat coming from the boat.
words.defineEn: (particularly of something unpleasant) likely to take place in the near future
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt của một cái gì đó khó chịu) có khả năng xảy ra trong tương lai gần

words.defineEn: offer as a sacrifice by killing or by giving up to destruction
words.defineVi: hiến tế bằng cách giết hoặc bằng cách từ bỏ sự hủy diệt

examples: She believes that killing animals for food or fur is completely immoral.
Nothing is immoral.
But, sexual drive can also fuel terribly immoral things, like sexual assault.
They are deeply immoral and an existential threat to all of us.
As you see modern capitalism, is it immoral in the way it functions right now?
words.defineEn: (of people and their behavior) considered bad or dishonest
words.defineVi: (của người và hành vi của họ) bị coi là xấu hoặc không trung thực

examples: And then, in the late sixteenth century, the skull was immortalized.
That grizzly image has since been immortalized as shorthand slang for single-minded cult-like thinking, "They drank the Kool-aid."

words.defineEn: make famous forever
words.defineVi: làm cho nổi tiếng mãi mãi

words.defineEn: to take a person or thing to a confined space and trap them there
words.defineVi: để đưa một người hoặc vật vào một không gian hạn chế và nhốt họ ở đó

examples: But it also talked about immutable laws of nature.

words.defineEn: not subject or susceptible to change or variation in form or quality or nature
words.defineVi: không thể hoặc dễ bị thay đổi hoặc thay đổi về hình thức hoặc chất lượng hoặc bản chất

words.defineEn: lose confidence or hope; become dejected
words.defineVi: mất tự tin hoặc hy vọng; trở nên chán nản

examples: It's almost despondent.

words.defineEn: without or almost without hope
words.defineVi: không có hoặc gần như không có hy vọng

examples: Regina King finished her film even as the culture was again convulsed by protests over racial injustice.

(BREAK) AMNA NAWAZ: The nation is convulsed again by a new spasm of shootings and the debate over how to stop them.

words.defineEn: cause to contract
words.defineVi: gây ra hợp đồng

examples: If your body was that temperature, you’d experience convulsions, brain damage, or maybe just die.
In high enough doses, it quickly leads to convulsions, paralysis, and death.

words.defineEn: violent uncontrollable contractions of muscles

examples: Now, in the 1930s, convulsive therapy was also introduced.
words.defineEn: affected by involuntary jerky muscular contractions; resembling a spasm
words.defineVi: bị ảnh hưởng bởi các cơn co thắt cơ bắp không tự nguyện; giống như một cơn co thắt
